attributes.action: Selling Bottled water in Airport shops at inflated prices a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
Prevent 'airside' vendors of bottled water charging higher prices for water than the equivalent bottle in UK shops. There cannot be any justification for this except sheer profiting from a captive audience.

Average price of 750ml bottled water in UK supermarkets = 85p
Price I was charged for a 750ml of bottled Airport water = £1.80

https://www.mysupermarket.co.uk/shelves/Bottled_Water_in_Tesco.html
attributes.background: A topic few people know that much about, is dehydration from air travel. Especially when you’re on a long-haul flight to the other side of the world. People get dehydrated on flights more than say doing a lot of walking because of one thing: a lack of humidity.

rejection.details: The UK Government and Parliament are not responsible for the price of water sold by shops at airports.
